Hey.

Oh, uh…

Uh…
I choose you.

Wow, indeed.
Yeah. You know what would make this moment perfect?

Not as good. You can’t make strings with it. Remind me to put it on your shopping list.
You have hypo-allergenic detergent?
Better put it on the list. If you wash my underwear with regular soap, I get little red bumps on my tuchus.

You don’t have to take me. You get to take me.

What? It’s fun. If I have no cavities, afterwards, we go out for a treat.

Didn’t you read my email?
Thank you.

That’s how I take it.
Me too.
Oh! Already? Why don’t you stay over?
Please, I think the woman can manage to put a wig on by herself.

Stay.
Go home.

What?
Great.
Sure.

Wrong answer.
I’m listening.
Agh!
Really?

This is so great. I love you, Howard.

Wow.

What?

Okay.
No.

I have to take you?

I can’t believe this.
All right, Howard, let’s get something straight right now. I’m not going to be your mother.

God forbid you get one of those new fancy sex diseases!

Who’s there? Are you a sex criminal?

Still arguing over which CSI is the best?

No.

I just want to talk to her.
What are you doing here?
Why didn’t you call?
I know. Last time I came on too strong. Can we talk in private?
The word is forbade.
Penny, this is Raj’s sister, Priya.
Really?
I thought maybe after we eat, we could see an early movie.
I love the way you say, I’d love that.
My sister’s 38 and married.

Whose tongue?
What, with my tongue in your tail?
Sheldon: What’s going on?
Did you offer him a hot beverage?
Leonard, social protocol states when a friend is upset, you offer them a hot beverage, such as tea.

You heard the man, Leonard. And while you’re at it, I’m upset that we have an unannounced houseguest, so make me cocoa. Point of inquiry, given that Leonard is your secondary friend and Koothrappali is your primary friend, why didn’t you seek refuge under his roof?
Cocoa, Leonard. Focus. I’m down in the dumps here.
Don’t worry. As your tertiary friend, I am prepared to step in and comfort you.
No, no. I’ll finish making the tea, while you narcissistically ramble on about whatever’s troubling you.
That’s what tertiary friends are for.
Would you be sleeping over again this evening? Because you’re welcome to.
Well, just keep in mind that should you ever need a slightly apathetic tertiary friend, I stand at the ready.
Hello.

Actually, he can. The Hindu Code of Manu is very clear in these matters. If a woman’s father is not around, the duty of controlling her base desires falls to the closest male member of her family, in this case, Raj. The code also states that if she disobeys, she will be reborn in the womb of a jackal and tormented by diseases. If true, that seems like an awfully large gamble given that the prize is Leonard.
Priya, if you’re experiencing any tension or awkwardness, it may stem from the fact that Leonard and Penny used to, if I may quote Howard, do the dance with no pants.
That’s remarkable. If pepperoni were an explosive substance, you could replace German shepherds at our nation’s airports.

No, no. It’s not an imposition. At this point, in our ecosystem, you are akin to the plover, a small scavenging bird that eats extra food from between the teeth of crocodiles. Please, fly into our open maw, and have at it.
Did you get the part?
Given the state of your career, can you really afford to be picky?
It’s actually Thai. You’re slipping.
They went to Catalina for the weekend.
At home, forbidding it.
I’m given to understand his mother grounded him for running away.
Actually, it’s the three of us.
Right. I’ll make tea.
I’m sorry. It’s not optional.
Raj: You heard me. I forbidded it.
Clearly, she was sending you a message to take a hike, Mike.

It’s completely inappropriate for a single woman to entertain a man in private. If you insist on talking, you must do it on the couch! All right, you may talk in the bedroom, but I want this door to remain open! All right, just this once you may close the door. But keep in mind I’ll be right out here monitoring the situation! (Dials phone) Oh, damn it. Leonard, when you get this message, call me. (Dials again) Priya, this is your brother. When you get this, tell Leonard to check his voicemail.
Why are you holding hands? I forbid you to hold hands.
Yeah, but you were just sleeping, because I forboded you to have sex.
Are you sure? That doesn’t sound right.
There it is, Priya. We’re Indian. We believe this stuff.
Some of it makes sense, some of it’s crazy. My point is, you can’t go out with Leonard.
Penny, you became disenchanted with Leonard as a lover. Would you please tell my sister why?
She says it the same way I do. I’d love that. Everybody in India says it that way. It’s not a big deal.
I’m not being a child. Leonard, I swear to God, if your sister ever comes to town, I shall have my way with her.
All the more shame that will fall upon the house of Hofstadter.
Priya: Open the door, Rajesh.
Forbidded it?
Get out of the way. What are you doing here?
I have business in Los Angeles.
I’m sorry. I thought about calling, but I just wasn’t sure if seeing you was such a good idea.
Sure.
Hi, Howard. Hi, Sheldon.
Rajesh, you know Leonard and I spent the night together.

I think it also says that if you eat beef, you need to live with cows for three months and drink their urine.
It’s very nice to meet you.
I’d love that.
Rajesh, don’t be a child.
Hi. Penny, right?
I know. Pretty boring, huh?
Thank you, Leonard. That doesn’t make it sound boring at all.

Ooh, I thought I smelled pizza.

Hi. So, um, Priya, you’re a lawyer, right?
Oh, yeah, yeah. It’s real great. Today I drove to Van Nuys for an audition I thought was going to be for a cat food commercial. Turned out to be porn.

Oh, okay. Well, I guess it’s just the two of us, huh?
Oh, sweetie, it’s okay. I don’t want tea.
Amy: I came as quickly as I could.
To comfort you, of course. Sheldon told me about Leonard dating Rajesh’s sister. So I high-tailed it over here to pick up the pieces of your broken heart.
You don’t have to be strong for me. Now let’s talk about Priya, that man-stealing bitch.
In situations like this, best girlfriends are often catty about the other woman. Rawr.
Oh. Then perhaps you don’t understand what’s going on. Your former boyfriend has replaced you with what appears to be a very suitable mate. Arguably much more suitable than you.

Well, granted, Penny, your secondary sexual characteristics are reasonably bodacious. But Priya is highly educated, she’s an accomplished professional, and she comes from the culture that literally wrote the book on neat ways to have sex. Whereas you, on the other hand, are a community college dropout who comes from the culture that wrote the book on tipping cows.

This is a portable electroencephalogram. I’m doing research on emotions and brain activity. So when you start crying, I can see which region of the brain is activated. Then I’m going to stimulate the analogous area in the brain of a rhesus monkey and see if he cries. Cool, huh?
Oh, who are you kidding? She’s breathtaking.
I’m regretting my earlier cattiness. She is an absolute delight.
I just wanted to check in on you.
It seems like the appropriate thing to do when one’s best friend finds herself replaced by a smart, beautiful woman with the smouldering sexuality of a crouched Bengal tiger.
Now, let’s get these electrodes attached and see what’s going on in that pretty little noggin of yours.
Sheldon, you have a guest who’s upset.
Mrs Wolowitz (off): Who’s that? Is it a sex criminal?
Amy (on webcam): What up, bestie? Good news. Thanks to you, I was able to make a rhesus monkey cry like a disgraced televangelist.
